comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: This could be either of two French communes with Ribecourt in their name. They are in close proximity to each other, and are both in same region as the other Bain Collection photos. They are Ribécourt-Dreslincourt and Ribécourt-la-Tour.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Original Agence Meurisse photo (Meurisse catalog number at right and bottom of Bain negative), published in 1914, at Gallica site has a different caption: A Ribecourt : une patrouille de premiers cuirassiers et de spahis marocains Pub. Date 1914 Information on the First Moroccan Spahi cavalry regiment, organized in 1914, at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1er_R%C3%A9giment_de_Spahis_Marocains

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: artolog: Thanks for providing us with the source, date, and original caption for this photograph.  We'll include this information next time we update the description.
